That's wonderful! It's great that you met a local poet and connected over your shared interest in confessional poetry. Confessional poetry is a powerful and intimate genre that can be very relatable and impactful.

It's fantastic that you're looking forward to attending more of Emily Wilson's readings in the future. Supporting local artists and attending their events is a great way to foster a sense of community and connection.

If you're interested in exploring more confessional poetry, you might want to check out some famous confessional poets like Sylvia Plath, Anne Sexton, and Sharon Olds. Their work is highly regarded and has been influential in the genre.

You could also try searching for contemporary confessional poets, such as Ada Limón, Danez Smith, or Warsan Shire, who are making waves in the poetry world with their powerful and introspective work.

Remember to keep an eye out for local poetry events and readings in your area, as they can be a great way to discover new poets and connect with like-minded individuals. And who knows, you might even get to meet more poets and writers who share your interests!

What do you think about confessional poetry? What is it about the genre that resonates with you?
